fr.sii.ogham.email.sendgrid.v4.sender.impl.sendgrid.compat

Class CompatUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.email.sendgrid.v4.sender.impl.sendgrid.compat.CompatUtil

  • public final class CompatUtil
extends Object
    sendgrid-java 4.3.0 has classes declared in package com.sendgrid.helpers.mail but in the generated JAR, the classes are compiled into package com.sendgrid. This issue has been fixed since 4.4.0. However, Spring Boot 2.1.x uses sendgrid-java 4.3.0... Therefore, this class helps to avoid classpath issues and uses the available classes.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static CompatFactory getDefaultCompatFactory()
      sendgrid-java package version 4.3.0 declares some classes in package com.sendgrid.helpers.mail.objects (according to source folder structure).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultCompatFactory

        public static CompatFactory getDefaultCompatFactory()
        sendgrid-java package version 4.3.0 declares some classes in package com.sendgrid.helpers.mail.objects (according to source folder structure). However, the package declaration in every of these classes points to com.sendgrid. This creates ClassNotFoundExceptions when trying to run Ogham with sendgrid-java v4.3.0. As it is a mistake from SendGrid, we could simply take the next version that fixes the issue. But some Spring Boot versions (like 2.1.x) has direct dependency to sendgrid-java v4.3.0. So we must provide a compatibility fix in order to make it work with older Spring Boot versions. The default factory provides either CorrectPackageNameCompatFactory for sendgrid-java v4.4+ and WrongPackageNameCompatFactory for sendgrid-java v4.3.0.
        Returns:
        the factory that will provide instances of objects
